models.name: flow_sphere_oauth_providers
models.description: OAuth providers registered in the system for user authentication. This table stores configuration details for third-party OAuth providers such as Google, GitHub, and others. It supports client_id, client_secret storage, redirect URIs, scopes, and authorization URLs. It enables modular OAuth provider management and integration with user authentication flow. References to OAuth tokens are made from {@link flow_sphere_oauth_tokens}.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description: Unique name of the OAuth provider (e.g., 'google', 'github').

plainFields.name: client_id
plainFields.description: Client ID obtained from the OAuth provider.

plainFields.name: client_secret
plainFields.description: Client secret key obtained from the OAuth provider, stored securely.

plainFields.name: authorization_url
plainFields.description: URL for initiating OAuth authorization flow.

plainFields.name: token_url
plainFields.description: URL for OAuth token exchange.

plainFields.name: redirect_uris
plainFields.description: Comma-separated list of valid redirect URIs for OAuth callbacks.

plainFields.name: scopes
plainFields.description: Space-separated list of OAuth scopes requested from the provider.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the OAuth provider configuration was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the OAuth provider configuration was last updated.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp; null means active.

models.name: flow_sphere_oauth_tokens
models.description: OAuth tokens issued to users for various providers. This table links individual user OAuth tokens to providers, storing access tokens, refresh tokens, and expiration times. It enforces referential integrity with the OAuth providers table {@link flow_sphere_oauth_providers} and user entities in the system.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: Linked user identifier from registered users or other user tables in the system. {@link flow_sphere_registered_user.id}

plainFields.name: access_token
plainFields.description: The OAuth access token for API access.

plainFields.name: refresh_token
plainFields.description: Refresh token used to obtain new access tokens, if applicable.

plainFields.name: expires_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp indicating when the access token expires.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp of this token record.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp of this token record.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft deletion timestamp; null when active.

models.name: flow_sphere_notification_services
models.description: Notification services registered in FlowSphere. Stores configuration and authentication details for external notification platforms like email, Slack, SMS, or other channels. Supports API keys, webhook URLs, and status tracking. Connected with notification dispatching subsystems.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description: Name of the notification service (e.g., 'slack', 'email').

plainFields.name: service_type
plainFields.description: Type/category of the notification service.

plainFields.name: api_key
plainFields.description: API key or token required to authenticate with the notification service.

plainFields.name: webhook_url
plainFields.description: Webhook URL for receiving event callbacks, if applicable.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current operational status of the service (e.g., 'active', 'inactive').

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the notification service was registered.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update timestamp of the notification service configuration.

plainFields.name: deleted_at

models.name: flow_sphere_storage_configs
models.description: Storage configuration details for external storage providers. This includes cloud storage credentials, connection endpoints, bucket names, and security settings. Supports modular and secure management of storage backends separate from system core.

plainFields.name: access_key

plainFields.name: secret_key
plainFields.description: Secret key or password for the storage provider.

plainFields.name: endpoint_url

plainFields.name: bucket_name
